title: Senior Web Front-End Developer
descriptionText:
Job Description

Active IRS Cleared (MBI) Required

Cherokee Nation Solutions Link (CNSL) is seeking a skilled Senior Front-End Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of professional front-end experience, proficient in modern web development tools, techniques, and methods. You will be responsible for front end web development using HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, React, and other related technologies. Additionally, you will ensure adherence to web standards, accessibility standards, and multi-lingual standards while collaborating within an Agile team environment. If you are passionate about creating exceptional user experiences and possess the required technical skills, we encourage you to apply.

Compensation & Benefits

Estimated Starting Salary Range for Senior Front-End Developer: $120,000 - $150,000

Pay commensurate with experience.

Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and other possible benefits as provided.Benefits are subject to change with or without notice.

Senior Front End Developer Responsibilities Include

 Front end web dev with HTML5, CSS, SASS, and modern frameworks.  Crafting user-centric web layouts and optimizing user experience.  Integrating RESTful APIs for Java web app interoperability.  Developing JavaScript code with modern standards and libraries.  Creating web layouts from static images and templates in full-stack frameworks.  Ensuring software meets web, accessibility, and multi-lingual standards.  Considering 508 compliances and localization formats.  System Analysis, Design and Development: Designing and implementing software applications.  Documenting APIs and technical concepts for diverse audiences.  Conducting alternative analysis and maintaining code artifacts.  Following Test-driven development (TDD) and DevOps practices.  Supporting automation and performance testing.  Providing Tier 3 support and assisting with packaging.  Utilizing Git, GitHub, and open-source solutions.  Mentoring developers and fostering collaborative work.  Agile Teamwork: Active participation in stand-ups and planning activities.  Effective communication with Scrum Master and team.  Conducting demos and updating tasks in Rational CLM.  Identifying dependencies and Enabler Stories.  Engaging in retrospectives and translating requirements into stories.  Performs other job-related duties as assigned 
Senior Front End Developer Experience, Education, Skills, Abilities Requested

 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology or a related field.  Active IRS Cleared (MBI)- required. Must have 5+ years of full-time professional front-end experience working on Agile teams and using modern web development tools, techniques, and methods for the creation and deployment of user-facing interfaces.  Proficient in client-side development tools and libraries: Node.js, NPM, Babel, Webpack, JavaScript, React, Create React App, Jest, Testing Library, Selenium , Jira, Confluence, React, AWS, Databricks  Strong understanding and application of web standards: CSS, HTML5.  Familiarity with accessibility standards: WCAG 2.0 (Section 508/WCAG 2.0 AA) and WAI-ARIA.  Experience with multi-lingual standards: Accessibility Standards (a11y), Internationalization (i18n), and Localization (l10n).  Must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal 

Company Information

Cherokee Nation Solutions Link (CNSL) is a part of Cherokee Federal ‚Äì the division of tribally owned federal contracting companies owned by Cherokee Nation Businesses. As a trusted partner for more than 60 federal clients, Cherokee Federal LLCs are focused on building a brighter future, solving complex challenges, and serving the government‚Äôs mission with compassion and heart. To learn more about CNSL, visit cherokee-federal.com.

#CherokeeFederal 

Cherokee Federal is a military friendly employer. Veterans and active military transitioning to civilian status are encouraged to apply.

Keywords

 Front End Development  Agile Teams  Web Standards  Accessibility Standards  Multi-lingual Standards 

Similar Job Titles

 Front End Engineer  Senior UI Developer  Front End Architect  Web Development Specialist  Senior Front End Software Engineer 

Legal Disclaimer

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected veteran status, disability or any other status protected under applicable federal, state or local law. 

 Many of our job openings require access to government buildings or military installations. Candidates must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal.

title: AI Prompt Engineer
descriptionText:
We are looking for an AI Prompt Engineer for a State client based out of NY.This is a long term role.
Key Responsibilities:Design, test, and refine prompts for various use cases, ensuring high-quality and consistent outputs from large language models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini).Analyze AI outputs to identify failure modes and develop strategies to mitigate them via prompt engineering, chaining, or other techniques.Develop and maintain a library of optimized prompts for different tasks and domains.Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate prompt solutions into user-facing applications and workflows.Experiment with advanced prompt strategies, such as zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and system messages.Conduct A/B tests and user studies to evaluate prompt effectiveness.Document prompt development processes, best practices, and guidelines to enable scaling of prompt engineering work.Stay up to date with the latest research and trends in generative AI, large language models, and prompt engineering.Required Qualifications:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, AI, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).Demonstrated experience with prompt engineering for large language models.Strong understanding of natural language processing (NLP) concepts and LLM behavior.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.Ability to write clear, effective prompts for diverse use cases.Familiarity with tools and APIs for interacting with LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex AI).Experience with Python or another scripting language.Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.
descriptionHtml:
We are looking for an AI Prompt Engineer for a State client based out of NY.

This is a long term role.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, test, and refine prompts for various use cases, ensuring high-quality and consistent outputs from large language models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini).
  • Analyze AI outputs to identify failure modes and develop strategies to mitigate them via prompt engineering, chaining, or other techniques.
  • Develop and maintain a library of optimized prompts for different tasks and domains.
  • Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate prompt solutions into user-facing applications and workflows.
  • Experiment with advanced prompt strategies, such as zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and system messages.
  • Conduct A/B tests and user studies to evaluate prompt effectiveness.
  • Document prompt development processes, best practices, and guidelines to enable scaling of prompt engineering work.
  • Stay up to date with the latest research and trends in generative AI, large language models, and prompt engineering.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, AI, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • Demonstrated experience with prompt engineering for large language models.
  • Strong understanding of natural language processing (NLP) concepts and LLM behavior.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Ability to write clear, effective prompts for diverse use cases.
  • Familiarity with tools and APIs for interacting with LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex AI).
  • Experience with Python or another scripting language.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

title: Tech Product Designer (UX/UI Designer)
descriptionText:
Description

About Us:

At Revive, we‚Äôre building exceptional products that meet the needs of our users. As a rapidly growing team, we are restructuring our design processes and scaling our design efforts to work closely with our expanding development team. We‚Äôre looking for a UX/UI Designer with experience in user research, usability, and data-driven decisions to join our team and help us build intuitive, user-centered designs. This is a unique opportunity to influence the design direction of a fast-moving company while collaborating with a passionate team of product managers, engineers, and designers. If you thrive in an environment where you can both design great user experiences and conduct research to improve them, this is the role for you.

Job Description

The Tech Product Designer (UX/UI Designer) balances user-centered research and intuitive, visually polished interface design. This role flexes between UX research and UI design execution based on project needs and works closely with product and engineering partners to ground decisions in data and user feedback. The Product Designer will contribute to design system development and collaborate across teams to deliver thoughtful, scalable, and effective product experiences.

This is a remote position with travel expected approximately once per quarter for in-person collaboration.

Duties

Shift fluidly between UX research and UI design based on project needs, contributing effectively to all phases of the product development lifecycle.Conduct user interviews, usability tests, and surveys to gather actionable insights that inform design decisions.Create high-quality wireframes, prototypes, and final UI designs that are visually appealing, intuitive, and user-centered.Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure designs meet business goals and user needs.Use user feedback and analytics to iterate on designs and improve the overall user experience.Contribute to and maintain a design system that supports consistency and scalability across the product.Actively participate in agile development processes and team collaboration sessionsPerform additional duties as assigned

What We Offer

Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.Flexible work hours and remote work options.Opportunities for professional growth and development.A collaborative and supportive team environment.

Requirements

3-5 years of experience in UX/UI design, with demonstrated strength in both user research and visual design.Strong ability to conduct user research, including interviews, usability testing, and surveys, and translate findings into actionable insights.Proficient in Figma; experience with design systems and component libraries.Strong communication and teamwork skills, with experience working closely with stakeholders and engineering teams in agile environments.Ability to leverage analytics and user feedback to make informed design decisions and iterate solutions.Creative in solving design challenges, with an understanding of how to balance user needs, business goals, and technical constraints.Experience working with or contributing to a design system to maintain consistency and scalability across platforms.A strong portfolio that demonstrates both UI design and UX research skills, with clear examples of user-centered design solutionsExperience with JiraExperience with FigJam, Miro or similar collaboration toolsExperience in agile environments and working closely with development teams to iterate on designsFamiliarity with accessibility standards and inclusive design practicesKnowledge of analytics tools (e.g., Hotjar and Mixpanel) to inform design decisions (preferred).
descriptionHtml:
Description



About Us:



At Revive, we‚Äôre building exceptional products that meet the needs of our users. As a rapidly growing team, we are restructuring our design processes and scaling our design efforts to work closely with our expanding development team. We‚Äôre looking for a UX/UI Designer with experience in user research, usability, and data-driven decisions to join our team and help us build intuitive, user-centered designs. This is a unique opportunity to influence the design direction of a fast-moving company while collaborating with a passionate team of product managers, engineers, and designers. If you thrive in an environment where you can both design great user experiences and conduct research to improve them, this is the role for you.



Job Description



The Tech Product Designer (UX/UI Designer) balances user-centered research and intuitive, visually polished interface design. This role flexes between UX research and UI design execution based on project needs and works closely with product and engineering partners to ground decisions in data and user feedback. The Product Designer will contribute to design system development and collaborate across teams to deliver thoughtful, scalable, and effective product experiences.



This is a remote position with travel expected approximately once per quarter for in-person collaboration.



Duties



  • Shift fluidly between UX research and UI design based on project needs, contributing effectively to all phases of the product development lifecycle.
  • Conduct user interviews, usability tests, and surveys to gather actionable insights that inform design decisions.
  • Create high-quality wireframes, prototypes, and final UI designs that are visually appealing, intuitive, and user-centered.
  • Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure designs meet business goals and user needs.
  • Use user feedback and analytics to iterate on designs and improve the overall user experience.
  • Contribute to and maintain a design system that supports consistency and scalability across the product.
  • Actively participate in agile development processes and team collaboration sessions
  • Perform additional duties as assigned



What We Offer



  • Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.
  • Flexible work hours and remote work options.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • A collaborative and supportive team environment.



Requirements



  • 3-5 years of experience in UX/UI design, with demonstrated strength in both user research and visual design.
  • Strong ability to conduct user research, including interviews, usability testing, and surveys, and translate findings into actionable insights.
  • Proficient in Figma; experience with design systems and component libraries.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills, with experience working closely with stakeholders and engineering teams in agile environments.
  • Ability to leverage analytics and user feedback to make informed design decisions and iterate solutions.
  • Creative in solving design challenges, with an understanding of how to balance user needs, business goals, and technical constraints.
  • Experience working with or contributing to a design system to maintain consistency and scalability across platforms.
  • A strong portfolio that demonstrates both UI design and UX research skills, with clear examples of user-centered design solutions
  • Experience with Jira
  • Experience with FigJam, Miro or similar collaboration tools
  • Experience in agile environments and working closely with development teams to iterate on designs
  • Familiarity with accessibility standards and inclusive design practices
  • Knowledge of analytics tools (e.g., Hotjar and Mixpanel) to inform design decisions (preferred).

title: Member Experience Architect
descriptionText:
Description

At Oura, our mission is to empower every person to own their inner potential. With our award-winning Oura Ring and app, we help over 2.5 million people turn insights about sleep, activity, and readiness into healthier, more balanced lives. We believe that starts from within ‚Äî by creating a culture where our team feels supported, included, and inspired to do their best work. Our values guide how we show up for each other and our community every day.

As the CX Strategist reporting to the Head of CX Strategy & Program Management, you will be a key driver in shaping a company's customer experience. You will play a vital role in understanding customer needs, developing effective strategies, and ensuring that the customer is at the heart of everything the member experience team does.

What you will do:

Strategic Planning and Execution - Craft comprehensive strategic plans designed to elevate the overall customer experience. Implement these plans meticulously, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and customer needs.

Data Analysis and Improvement - Scrutinize customer feedback and data with meticulous attention to detail. Identify key areas where improvements can be made to the customer journey. Develop and implement targeted solutions to address these identified areas, fostering a continually improving customer experience.

Customer Journey Mapping - Create frameworks and visualizations of the customer journey to identify touchpoints, understand interactions, and pinpoint areas for optimization.

Industry Research and Trend Analysis - Conduct in-depth research on industry best practices and emerging trends in the field of customer experience. Stay informed about the latest advancements and integrate relevant knowledge into CX strategies and initiatives. Follow the competition and customers, assessing opportunities and threats, and utilizing external data points to influence plans for differentiation.

Performance Monitoring and Reporting - Establish and maintain a robust system for tracking CX performance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs). Generate detailed reports on CX performance, providing valuable insights into areas of success and those requiring further attention.

Cross-Functional Collaboration - Actively collaborate with diverse cross-functional teams, including but not limited to, product, engineering, and marketing departments. Work in synergy with these teams to integrate customer experience initiatives seamlessly into the broader organizational framework.

Documentation and Reporting - Create and diligently maintain comprehensive project documentation. This includes, but is not limited to, project plans, detailed timelines, and regular, up-to-date status reports. Ensure all project-related information is accurately recorded and readily accessible.

Drive customer-centricity - Promote a customer-focused culture within the organization by educating teams on CX principles and best practices.

Risk Management - Proactively identify potential risks that could impede the progress or success of CX projects. Develop and implement mitigation strategies to address these risks, ensuring projects remain on track and potential issues are minimized.

Requirements

We would love to have you on our team if you have:

Strong ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions related to customer experience.10+ years of experience in strategy or customer experience, with a proven track record of driving strategic CX initiatives.Demonstrated understanding of financial concepts, investment and ROI analysis, budgeting, and forecasting and modeling techniques .Ability to manage projects, track progress, and ensure deliverables are met on time and within budget.Proven leadership or contribution to executive decision making and logical cascade to managing projects and CX initiatives.Lead CX strategy sessions, getting executive buy-in and addressing concernsExcellent problem-solving and analytical skills related to customer experience.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Experience with project management tools (e.g., Google Sheets, project management software).Strong customer service orientation.

Benefits

At Oura, we care about you and your well-being. Everyone here at Oura has a ring of their own and we are continually looking to improve employee health.

What we offer:

Competitive salary and equity packagesHealth, dental, vision insurance, and mental health resourcesAn Oura Ring of your own plus employee discounts for friends & family20 days of paid time off plus 13 paid holidays plus 8 days of flexible wellness time offPaid sick leave and parental leave

Oura takes a market-based approach to pay, which may vary depending on your location. US locations are categorized into tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. While most offers will be closer to the starting range, successful candidates' pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, internal peer equity, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Region 1: $125,000-$156,000Region 2: $109,000-$136,000Region 3: $104,000-$130,000

A recruiter can determine your zones/tiers based on your US location.

We are not considering candidates residing in the following states: Alaska (AK), Arkansas (AR), Delaware (DE), Iowa (IA), Mississippi (MS), Missouri (MO), Nebraska (NE), South Dakota (SD), Vermont (VT), West Virginia (WV), and Wisconsin (WI)

Oura is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Individuals seeking employment at Oura are considered without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Disclaimer: Beware of fake job offers!

We‚Äôve been alerted to scammers posing as ≈åURA recruiters, especially for remote roles. Please note:

Our jobs are listed only on the ≈åURA Careers page and trusted job boards.We will never ask for personal information like ID or payment for equipment upfront.Official offers are sent through Docusign after a verbal offer, not via text or email.

Stay cautious and protect your personal details.

To all recruitment agencies: Oura does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Oura employees, or any other organization's location. Oura is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Oura is an award-winning and fast-growing startup that helps people track all stages of sleep and activity using the Oura Ring and connected app. By providing daily feedback and practical steps to inspire healthy lifestyles, we've helped hundreds of thousands of people improve their sleep, understand their bodies, and transform their health. JOIN THE OURA TEAM

title: Senior/Staff Product Manager, Shopping
descriptionText:
Join Our Journey at Engine

At Engine, we're revolutionizing work travel. Our modern travel platform isn't just about booking trips; it's about transforming how businesses and their teams experience travel. From seamless booking options with top airlines, hotels, and car rental providers to single-invoice billing and flexible trip modifications, we make travel not only easier to manage but also enjoyable. Backed by powerhouse investors like Telescope Partners, Blackstone, Elefund, and Permira, we're growing fast‚Äîand we want you to be part of it.

Ideal candidates are based in San Francisco or New York, and are willing to work a hybrid 3 days a week schedule in office. 

Join Our Journey at Engine

At Engine, we're revolutionizing work travel. Our modern travel platform isn't just about booking trips; it's about transforming how businesses and their teams experience travel. From seamless booking options with top airlines, hotels, and car rental providers to single-invoice billing and flexible trip modifications, we make travel not only easier to manage but also enjoyable. Backed by powerhouse investors like Telescope Partners, Blackstone, Elefund, and Permira, we're growing fast‚Äîand we want you to be part of it.

Your Mission:

At Engine, you'll be at the heart of innovation, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the business travel space. We're looking for a passionate product manager to drive transformation and deliver seamless shopping and booking experiences that make a measurable impact on our customers and business.

What You'll Do

Define and Drive Product Strategy

Shape a compelling product vision for the search and shop booking journey with flights, hotels, or rental cars.Balance user-centric design with business impact, applying modern product techniques and leveraging emerging technologies like AI for personalized recommendations.

Collaborate Across Functions

Work closely with engineers, designers, data teams, and business stakeholders to define and deliver features that improve discovery, selection, and booking.Foster inclusive team discussions and champion shared goals across multiple workstreams.

Deliver Impactful Solutions

Lead the design and rollout of scalable search and shop features that drive conversion, build user confidence, and improve the overall shopping journey.

Use Data to Inform Decisions

Combine customer research, behavioral insights, and experimentation to guide decision-making and optimize outcomes.Run experiments and continuously test and iterate to ensure our solutions are delivering maximum value.

Communicate with Clarity

Translate complex ideas into clear, actionable plans.Keep teams and stakeholders aligned by telling compelling stories around the "why" behind product priorities and trade-offs.

What You'll Bring to Engine:

Experience: 5+ years in product management, ideally with experience in travel tech, marketplaces, or booking platforms. Bonus points for experience within the travel space, but not required.Collaboration: Strong track record of cross-functional collaboration and ability to influence across teams and functions.User-Centered Thinking: Deep empathy for users, with a solid understanding of UX principles and the ability to translate customer needs into intuitive solutions.Analytical Approach: Experience using data, experimentation, and A/B testing to validate hypotheses and inform roadmap decisions.

The Engine Edge: Perks & Compensation

We believe in rewarding great work with great benefits:

Compensation: Competitive base pay tied to role and experience, with opportunities for bonuses, commissions, and equity.Benefits: Check out our full list at engine.com/culture.

Environments for Success: Different roles have different needs in terms of the environments that drive success which is why we have a hybrid-hub model. Whether you are in one of our amazing offices or fully remote, we'll make sure you have what you need to succeed.

Ready to Build the Future of Work Travel?

Join us on our mission to transform how work travel works‚Äîfor businesses, for travelers, and for the industry. Apply now and let's make travel simpler, smarter, and more enjoyable‚Äîtogether.

Compensation

Our compensation packages are based on several factors, including your experience and expertise. In addition to a competitive base salary, total compensation may include equity and/or variable pay (OTE). Your recruiter will share your complete compensation package as you move through the process.

Base Pay Range

$180,000‚Äî$220,000 USD

The Engine Edge: Perks & Compensation

We believe in rewarding great work with great benefits:

At Engine, we're revolutionizing work travel. Our modern travel platform isn't just about booking trips; it's about transforming how businesses and their teams experience travel. MLOps Engineer | Python | Machine Learning | GCP | Kubernetes | CI/CD | Remote, UK
descriptionHtml:
MLOps Engineer | Python | Machine Learning | GCP | Kubernetes | CI/CD | Remote, UK


About Us

We are an early-stage biotechnology company using live cell imaging and artificial intelligence to predict stem cell behavior. Our goal is to improve the manufacturing of human cells for research and therapeutic use by enabling a deeper understanding of cell differentiation. Founded in 2022 as a spin-out from a leading UK research institution, we are backed by prominent venture capital firms with experience investing in AI, life sciences, and deep tech startups.


What We‚Äôre Building

At the core of our technology is a proprietary AI-powered SaaS platform that enables scientists to visualize, track, and predict cell differentiation in real-time. Designed to support high-throughput experiments, the platform integrates microscopy, computer vision, cloud infrastructure, and machine learning to accelerate advancements in cell biology and biomanufacturing.


We are currently seeking a DevOps / MLOps Engineer to help scale our cloud infrastructure and machine learning workflows as part of our growing technical team.


Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain infrastructure for our SaaS platform that delivers AI-driven computer vision tools to researchers and scientists.
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, and biologists.
  • Build and support GPU-accelerated environments for training and real-time inference of deep learning models.
  • Deploy and manage ML pipelines using tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and frameworks such as Kubeflow or Ray.
  • Create and document APIs that enable internal and external users to access data and model outputs.
  • Implement secure authentication and authorization systems for platform users.
  • Maintain and improve our cloud platform‚Äôs reliability, security, and compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA readiness).
  • Automate testing, training, and deployment of models through robust CI/CD pipelines.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot performance issues across data and inference workflows in production.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience in DevOps, MLOps, SRE, or Data Engineering roles.
  • Strong proficiency with public cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, or Azure), with preference for GCP.
  • Expertise in Terraform and infrastructure-as-code practices.
  • Solid experience deploying workloads with Kubernetes, including cluster and node management.
  • Familiarity with ML workload orchestration using Docker, Kubeflow, Ray, or similar tools.
  • Skilled in Python and comfortable working with SQL and data processing tools.
  • Understanding of the machine learning lifecycle from data ingestion to inference.
  • Experience handling large-scale datasets and optimizing data pipelines.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to clearly document complex systems.
  • A self-driven mindset and interest in staying current with trends in cloud, data, and ML tools.
  • Experience leading infrastructure efforts in greenfield or early-stage environments.

Nice to Have

  • Experience working on SaaS platforms in biotech, healthcare, or life sciences.
  • Experience with real-time ML inference and production monitoring.
  • Familiarity with computer vision models and workflows.
  • Understanding of data privacy regulations and scientific data formats (e.g., TIFF, OME-TIFF).
  • Background working in early-stage startups (seed or Series A).

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits.
  • Growth opportunities and professional development.
  • A collaborative, forward-thinking environment at the intersection of AI and biotechnology.
  • A meaningful mission with the potential to impact healthcare through innovation in science and technology.

Why Join Us

You'll be part of a rapidly growing, interdisciplinary team working on complex challenges in AI and biology. Your contributions will shape the technical foundation of our product and accelerate both scientific discovery and therapeutic development. This is an opportunity to make a tangible impact during a pivotal stage of growth.


MLOps Engineer | Python | Machine Learning | GCP | Kubernetes | CI/CD | Remote, UK

title: Data Software Engineer Python PySpark
descriptionText:
Data Software Engineer (Python PySpark) Remote UK to ¬£95k
Are you a data savvy Software Engineer with strong Python coding skills?
You could be progressing your career in a senior, hands-on Data Software Engineer role as part of a friendly and supportive international team at a growing and hugely successful European car insurance tech company as they expand their UK presence; their platform enables an insurance quote to be made to the consumer within 60 seconds, using just 4 clicks.
As a Data Software Engineer within the Claims team you will help shape the architecture of data products, building reusable technology that enables teams to ingest, store, transform and serve their own data products. You'll take a lead in data transformation, setting up best practices in areas like Data modelling, performance optimisation and Data Governance to ensure that the data used within the business is consistent, available and reliable.
You will be supported with continual learning and self development opportunities and will be encouraged to contribute to testing open source tools and engaging in community building activities such as meet-ups, keeping up to date with new and emerging technologies and methods.

title: Junior QA Automation Engineer
descriptionText:
Position: Junior QA Automation Engineer

Location: UK Remote

Reports to: Head of Development

About Us

At Happydance, we‚Äôre redefining HR technology through innovative, user-centric digital solutions. We believe in delivering exceptional experiences to our clients, and quality assurance is at the heart of everything we do. Join our team as a Junior QA Automation Engineer and play a critical role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and reliable software solutions.

Role Overview

As a Junior QA Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automated test frameworks and scripts to ensure the quality and functionality of our products. Working closely with development and product teams, you will help define and uphold quality standards, troubleshoot issues, and drive continuous improvement in our testing processes.

Key Responsibilities

Test Automation:

Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks and scripts for functional, regression, and performance testing. Implement and execute automated tests to identify bugs and ensure product quality. Continuously optimize automation frameworks to improve efficiency and scalability. 

Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with development and product teams to understand requirements and define test strategies. Identify and document test cases, scenarios, and test data for automation. Perform root cause analysis on defects and work with developers to resolve issues. Maintain comprehensive test documentation, including test plans, reports, and results. 

Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD):

Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to enable continuous testing and deployment. Monitor test results in CI/CD environments and provide timely feedback to stakeholders. 

Process Improvement:

Advocate for quality best practices across the organization. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in QA and test automation. Proactively identify areas for process improvement and implement innovative solutions. From time to time, you may be required to work flexibly to accommodate our valued US-based customers, ensuring our global commitment to exceptional service. 

Qualifications & Skills

The Must-Haves:

Proven experience in QA automation, with expertise in designing and implementing test frameworks. Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or JavaScript for test automation. Strong experience with automation tools like Selenium, Cypress, Appium, or similar. Familiarity with API testing tools such as Postman or RestAssured. Knowledge of CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps) and version control systems (e.g., Git). Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. 

The Nice-to-Haves

Experience in performance testing tools like JMeter or LoadRunner. Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Knowledge of security testing and tools. ISTQB or equivalent certification. 

Why Join Us?

Impactful Work: Contribute to delivering high-quality software solutions that make a difference. Collaborative Culture: Work with a supportive team that values innovation and excellence. Professional Growth: Access opportunities for training, mentorship, and career advancement. Flexible Work: Benefit from competitive compensation, bonus opportunities, and remote working arrangements. 

Our Core Values 

We See you. (The one about empathy) We not only understand, but we feel what customers and candidates are experiencing We take care. (The one about Thoughtfulness) We use deep understanding to take careful, intentional action that improves experiences. We‚Äôve got this. (The one about collaboration We have complete trust in each other‚Äôs unique skills and know we will succeed as a team when we work together. We‚Äôre all in. (The one about focus) We‚Äôre obsessed with experiences that move people, and we use this discipline to stay aligned with our mission: to deliver the best possible candidate and customer experience. We make it happen. (The one about action) We‚Äôre never static. Our expertise, solutions and service are constantly evolving, and we‚Äôre always innovating to deliver competitive advantage 

Apply Now

If you‚Äôre a skilled Junior QA Automation Engineer with a passion for quality and innovation, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Join Happydance and help us deliver exceptional digital experiences to our clients and users.

title: Salesforce QA Tester
descriptionText:
Salesforce QA Tester | Remote | ¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000
I'm working with an innovative company seeking a Salesforce QA Tester to join their team. This company is at the forefront of a significant transformation, providing you with a unique opportunity to influence a greenfield project from its inception.
Although they have offices in the Midlands, they offer a fully remote working arrangement, fostering a flexible and supportive work environment. This company is characterised by its small, friendly atmosphere where collaboration and personal growth are highly valued. Their ongoing projects are not just transformative for the business but also offer significant learning and development opportunities for their employees.
As a Salesforce QA Tester here, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of Salesforce implementations, with a strong focus on telephony integrations and Salesforce CPQ. You‚Äôll work closely with developers, business analysts, and release managers to validate complex configurations and ensure seamless user experiences.
Key Responsibilities:Test and validate Salesforce CPQ configurations and telephony integrations.Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to ensure accurate implementation of pricing, quoting, and call-handling workflows.Identify and troubleshoot issues across the Salesforce platform, including CPQ logic and telephony flows.Support end-to-end testing cycles and contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes.
Ideal Candidate:Proven experience testing Salesforce CPQ and/or telephony solutions (e.g., Amazon Connect, Genesys, Twilio).Strong understanding of Salesforce data models, quoting processes, and call routing logic.Familiarity with Git and CI/CD tools is a plus.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Open to candidates from various backgrounds who are eager to grow in a QA role with a focus on CPQ and telephony.
Sound interesting? Click APPLY to find out more or get in touch at kim.ocallaghan@opusrs.com

title: Senior Design Manager (Infrastructure)
descriptionText:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a senior design manager to play a key role making open source software available to the world. Our Design function ensures the experience of the software and infrastructure we build is true to our intentions, and delivers the tools our community and customers need. The Design Manager makes this possible through leadership within, and beyond, our teams.

As a Senior Design Manager, you bring both experience managing design teams and have expertise in a deeply technical domain. This enables you to coach designers in creating tools for developers and cloud engineers, and cross-context to move towards tangible outcomes and lift the quality of their work. You will manage expectations and ensure deadlines are met in a timely manner against your roadmap. You will be able to communicate clearly and actively listen to product and engineering stakeholders, and your team, to drive sustainable quality improvements and guide individuals towards meaningful growth.

Leading the Infrastructure Design team, you will take responsibility for the products that help to build cloud experiences and software distribution mechanisms, and you will help to evolve the security of how software is packaged and delivered.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region

What the role entails

Reviewing the work of your design team for qualityWorking with individual designers to support their professional growthContinuously improving operational workflows, including production outsourcing and collaboration with Web EngineeringWorking with stakeholders, especially the Engineering organization, to clearly define and validate outcomesEvolving design systems and guidelines to drive consistent quality and improve efficiencyCoordinating with the rest of design leadership to mature our collective practiceBringing your team and others together to share their work and strengthen cultureEngaging the open source community to learn and make the value of our work legible


What we are looking for in you

A portfolio demonstrating outstanding quality in UX design and savviness in technologyExceptional educational achievements in design or related behavioral science disciplineFull lifecycle experience from user needs discovery through validation and implementation guidanceCommitment to transparent project delivery and owning team deadlinesExperience of managing a team that interacts with technical stakeholdersFamiliarity with quantitative optimisation approachesA passion for balancing consistency and innovationWillingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

Fully remote working environment - we‚Äôve been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at ‚Äòsprints‚ÄôPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

company.name: Canonical
company.description:
We deliver open source to the world faster,  more securely and more cost effectively than any other company.

We're also the publishers of Ubuntu, the world‚Äôs most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000+ contributors. 

Ubuntu means 'humanity to others'‚Äã. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation.

Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers.

Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - this is the future of open source, which is why we're proud to be the developers of the fastest growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

If you're interested in a career at Canonical, we are a remote-first company so please apply to any suitable role as skills are valued more than location, despite some having a preferred geographic preference. 

www.canonical.com

title: Lead Industrial Product Designer [349]
descriptionText:
About the Company:Manta Sleep - was founded in 2016, and their team specializes in creating innovative sleep accessories designed to enhance sleep quality. Their flagship products include a variety of sleep masks and sleep accessories, all engineered to provide perfect sleep conditions for their users. The company is a strong advocate for the Pro-Nap Movement, promoting the benefits of regular napping and challenging traditional corporate norms that discourage rest during work hours. Their mission centers on empowering individuals to unlock their full potential through better sleep, offering products that cater to various sleep needs and preferences.
About the Role:We are looking to hire a mature and experienced Lead Industrial Product Designer who will be responsible for shaping the company‚Äôs product vision and leading the design team to create innovative sleep products that resonate with customers. You will work hands-on in a fast-growing e-commerce environment, balancing strategic planning with execution while managing a small but expanding team of designers and product managers.
The role requires a deep understanding of user needs, ensuring that each product launched not only meets high design standards but also drives business growth. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with product design, marketing, and report directly to leadership to bring products to market successfully. With a global team spread across Europe and Asia, the candidate must be adaptable and capable of leading design efforts in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.
This is a Full-Time remote role.Salary Range: 70- 100k USD annually
We are looking for a Lead Industrial Product Designer specifically with these requirements:
Ideally, 5-10 years of experience in a Product Design role, having both hands-on and leadership experience.Previous experience in a smaller to mid-sized E-commerce business, with at least a $30M-$50M revenue.Experience designing soft products or similar (home or textile goods) is a must.Proven track record of building and managing small design teams.Ability to plan for product launches over the next 3+ years.Understanding of how to create products that customers love and that are feasible from the engineering side.Experience working closely with the product and marketing teams, and with external agencies when needed.Comfortable making decisions in a fast-paced environment with limited corporate infrastructure.Experience working with international teams across different time zones.Open to occasional travel, especially to Asia, for product development purposes.Strong communication and leadership skills, while being able to find a good balance between creative ideas and feasible solutions.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):
Develop and implement a long-term product design strategy aligned with business growth objectives.Be directly involved in design processes, from concept to launch, ensuring a balance of vision and execution.Oversee the design and launch of products that drive customer engagement and sales.Build, manage, and mentor a growing team of designers and product managers.Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment where creativity and efficiency thrive.Work closely with the product, marketing, and leadership team to bring products to market successfully.Ensure seamless coordination between design, production, engineering and marketing efforts.Iterate on product design based on user feedback, data, and market trends.Stay updated on design trends, customer preferences, and industry innovations.Use data-driven insights to enhance product design and user experience.Occasional travel to Asia - approx 3 times a year for product development and production coordination.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:
Freedom and control over your schedule.Open and transparent workplace.Freedom to be creative and own your work.No office politics or bureaucracyGreat growth opportunities and training resources.Unlimited vacation and sick leave days.
This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶
You're a visionary problem solver.You won‚Äôt be expected to have all the answers from day one, but you‚Äôll need to think strategically, adapt quickly, and drive innovative product designs that align with business goals.
You're highly organized and hands-on.You can balance big-picture vision with hands-on execution, ensuring that design projects move forward smoothly while leading and growing a small, agile team.
You're passionate about creating products people love.You understand the intersection of design, functionality, and customer needs, ensuring that every product developed is not just well-designed but also highly desirable and marketable.

Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!
descriptionHtml:
About the Company:

Manta Sleep - was founded in 2016, and their team specializes in creating innovative sleep accessories designed to enhance sleep quality. Their flagship products include a variety of sleep masks and sleep accessories, all engineered to provide perfect sleep conditions for their users. The company is a strong advocate for the Pro-Nap Movement, promoting the benefits of regular napping and challenging traditional corporate norms that discourage rest during work hours. Their mission centers on empowering individuals to unlock their full potential through better sleep, offering products that cater to various sleep needs and preferences.


About the Role:

We are looking to hire a mature and experienced Lead Industrial Product Designer who will be responsible for shaping the company‚Äôs product vision and leading the design team to create innovative sleep products that resonate with customers. You will work hands-on in a fast-growing e-commerce environment, balancing strategic planning with execution while managing a small but expanding team of designers and product managers.


The role requires a deep understanding of user needs, ensuring that each product launched not only meets high design standards but also drives business growth. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with product design, marketing, and report directly to leadership to bring products to market successfully. With a global team spread across Europe and Asia, the candidate must be adaptable and capable of leading design efforts in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.


This is a Full-Time remote role.

Salary Range: 70- 100k USD annually


We are looking for a Lead Industrial Product Designer specifically with these requirements:


  • Ideally, 5-10 years of experience in a Product Design role, having both hands-on and leadership experience.
  • Previous experience in a smaller to mid-sized E-commerce business, with at least a $30M-$50M revenue.
  • Experience designing soft products or similar (home or textile goods) is a must.
  • Proven track record of building and managing small design teams.
  • Ability to plan for product launches over the next 3+ years.
  • Understanding of how to create products that customers love and that are feasible from the engineering side.
  • Experience working closely with the product and marketing teams, and with external agencies when needed.
  • Comfortable making decisions in a fast-paced environment with limited corporate infrastructure.
  • Experience working with international teams across different time zones.
  • Open to occasional travel, especially to Asia, for product development purposes.
  • Strong communication and leadership skills, while being able to find a good balance between creative ideas and feasible solutions.


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):


  • Develop and implement a long-term product design strategy aligned with business growth objectives.
  • Be directly involved in design processes, from concept to launch, ensuring a balance of vision and execution.
  • Oversee the design and launch of products that drive customer engagement and sales.
  • Build, manage, and mentor a growing team of designers and product managers.
  • Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment where creativity and efficiency thrive.
  • Work closely with the product, marketing, and leadership team to bring products to market successfully.
  • Ensure seamless coordination between design, production, engineering and marketing efforts.
  • Iterate on product design based on user feedback, data, and market trends.
  • Stay updated on design trends, customer preferences, and industry innovations.
  • Use data-driven insights to enhance product design and user experience.
  • Occasional travel to Asia - approx 3 times a year for product development and production coordination.

Growth Opportunities/Perks:


  • Freedom and control over your schedule.
  • Open and transparent workplace.
  • Freedom to be creative and own your work.
  • No office politics or bureaucracy
  • Great growth opportunities and training resources.
  • Unlimited vacation and sick leave days.

This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶


You're a visionary problem solver.

You won‚Äôt be expected to have all the answers from day one, but you‚Äôll need to think strategically, adapt quickly, and drive innovative product designs that align with business goals.


You're highly organized and hands-on.

You can balance big-picture vision with hands-on execution, ensuring that design projects move forward smoothly while leading and growing a small, agile team.


You're passionate about creating products people love.

You understand the intersection of design, functionality, and customer needs, ensuring that every product developed is not just well-designed but also highly desirable and marketable.



Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

title: User Experience Designer (UX/UI)
descriptionText:
Job Title: UX/UI Designer (Mid-Level) Industry: Access Management Solutions/SaaSLocation: Remote (Please only apply if based in UK - this is mandatory)Salary Range: Circa ¬£55,000
WeDo have partnered with a business who are considered to be a market leader in the key and access management field. As a business, they have a wide product portfolio underpinned by complex technology/IoT. They have also recently merged with their sister company which only adds to their project portfolio. Off the back of this merger and recent promotions, this has led to an opportunity for a UX designer (with an appreciation for UI) to join at what is arguably one of the most exciting growth periods for the business. This is working alongside a phenomenal UX Architect who we onboarded circa 2 years back....
Requirements;-Initially working with one relatively small engineering team, you will be presenting and communicating design concepts to a range of stakeholders The product lends itself to someone who has a "functional" mindset, ideally with a background in embedded apps/SaaS/tooling Adobe XD/Figma with a strong portfolio Understanding of front-end principles - HTML/CSS (no coding required) Prototyping conveying concept designs to stakeholders/end users A pragmatic but also, growth mindset 
This is a remote opportunity with very occasional travel - one day every couple of months.Interview slots are available with an expected turnaround time to be 7-14 days from start to finish. Two stage process, likely to include a presentation/walk-through of a solution. 
There is no sponsorship on offer and you need to be based in the UK to be considered for this one.Please apply now for further consideration.
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: UX/UI Designer (Mid-Level)

Industry: Access Management Solutions/SaaS

Location: Remote (Please only apply if based in UK - this is mandatory)

Salary Range: Circa ¬£55,000


WeDo have partnered with a business who are considered to be a market leader in the key and access management field. As a business, they have a wide product portfolio underpinned by complex technology/IoT. They have also recently merged with their sister company which only adds to their project portfolio. Off the back of this merger and recent promotions, this has led to an opportunity for a UX designer (with an appreciation for UI) to join at what is arguably one of the most exciting growth periods for the business. This is working alongside a phenomenal UX Architect who we onboarded circa 2 years back....


Requirements;-

  • Initially working with one relatively small engineering team, you will be presenting and communicating design concepts to a range of stakeholders
  • The product lends itself to someone who has a "functional" mindset, ideally with a background in embedded apps/SaaS/tooling
  • Adobe XD/Figma with a strong portfolio
  • Understanding of front-end principles - HTML/CSS (no coding required)
  • Prototyping conveying concept designs to stakeholders/end users
  • A pragmatic but also, growth mindset

This is a remote opportunity with very occasional travel - one day every couple of months.

Interview slots are available with an expected turnaround time to be 7-14 days from start to finish. Two stage process, likely to include a presentation/walk-through of a solution.


There is no sponsorship on offer and you need to be based in the UK to be considered for this one.

Please apply now for further consideration.
